Pre-Game Insights: White-ball captain Jos Buttler is out of the series with a hamstring injury, meaning Phil Salt will step up as captain.
Phil Salt will become the first Welsh-born cricketer to lead an international England side on Welsh soil when he takes on the Aussies in Cardiff on Friday.
Marcus Trescothick is standing in as coach until Test supremo Brendon McCullum expands his role to the two white-ball formats from January.
The series against Australia could be key to determining who stays in the mix for the England white-ball team.
England underperformed at the T20 World Cup earlier this year and last year they flopped when defending their ODI World Cup, so all eyes are on whether the side have made drastic improvements.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The final and potentially deciding match of the ODI series will take place at Gloucestershire’s Seat Unique Stadium in Bristol, which has faced controversy due to a poor hybrid pitch.
Gloucestershire will host a 'hybrid pitch walkthrough' to counteract claims that their surface isn’t up to hosting internationals.
